decks.notes: This deck focuses on combining powerful instant reanimation effects with disruptive creatures like Solitude and Grief to quickly assemble a dominant board presence. With cards like Ephemerate and Goryo's Vengeance, players can bring back key threats like Atraxa, Grand Unifier or Griselbrand from the graveyard to overwhelm opponents. Tainted Indulgence helps filter through the deck, while Fallaji Archaeologist provides additional graveyard recursion. Thoughtseize and Prismatic Ending offer disruption and removal options, while the land base supports the deck's color requirements and enables fast mana development.

This deck focuses on assembling a combination of creatures using cards like Chord of Calling and Agatha's Soul Cauldron to create powerful synergies and win conditions. The deck makes use of toolbox creatures like Grist, the Hunger Tide, Yawgmoth, Thran Physician, and Blood Artist to control the board and gain advantage over the opponent. The inclusion of Boseiju, Who Endures and The One Ring provides additional utility and protection for the combo pieces. Overall, the strategy revolves around efficiently utilizing creature abilities and combos to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent.

The deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with cycling cards like Street Wraith and Architects of Will, while controlling the board with cards like Force of Negation and Subtlety. Once the graveyard is full, the player can cast Living End to bring back all the creatures from the graveyard, overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures like Waker of Waves and Curator of Mysteries. The deck also includes options like Generous Ent and Grief to disrupt the opponent's strategy and prevent them from countering the combo.

The deck focuses on using Martyr of Sands to gain life and trigger effects of cards like Abiding Grace and Solitude, while also controlling the board with cards like Ranger-Captain of Eos and Skyclave Apparition. The goal is to outvalue the opponent by gaining life, controlling the board, and ultimately overwhelming them with powerful creatures and removal spells. The deck has a strong aggro component, putting pressure on the opponent early in the game while also having a resilient late game plan with cards like Emeria, the Sky Ruin and Leyline Binding.

This Rakdos Aggro deck focuses on disrupting opponents with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and aggressive creatures like Grief and Dauthi Voidwalker. It also includes removal spells like Fatal Push and Terminate to control the board. The deck aims to apply constant pressure on opponents while disrupting their game plan, using cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and Angrath's Rampage to gain advantage. Additionally, the deck utilizes versatile cards like Kolaghan's Command and Blood Moon to adapt to different matchups and situations, creating a fast-paced and ruthless playstyle.

This deck focuses on assembling a combo using cards like Indomitable Creativity and Persist to cheat out powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty. The key strategy is to use the deck's creativity and versatility to surprise opponents and disrupt their game plan. By combining card draw, removal spells, and mana fixing, the deck aims to control the board while setting up its combo win condition. The deck also includes flexible options like Lightning Bolt and Thoughtseize to handle a variety of threats and disrupt opponent's strategies.
